comments:
** Ensure no custom resolver plugins are active.  Close /org.eclipse.jst.jsf.dtresolver.test if present in your workspace, befor launching the debug workspace **

1) Create a JSF project and a JSP file in it.  Use the JSP XML format (I haven't verified 100% but this may be required).
2) Overwrite the JSF file with attachment 1 and open with WPE.
3) Add a file called messages.properties to a src folder package called "bundles".
4) Go into commandButton value and do a Ctrl-Space on "bundle.".  You don't have select anything (i.e. hit Esc once the assist appears).  Just make sure you active the content assist.
5) Now rename the containing project with WPE still open.
6) Now try to click on the design area of WPE.  You should get copious exceptions similar to the one below.

It appears that issue is related to images being used by the design viewer being disposed too early or the HiddenProvider not updating it's image handles correctly.  Note that the exception triggered in HTMLEditor in propertyChanged traces through reseting the editor input.

Note that the issue reasonably severe because the WPE becomes unusable until it is closed and re-opened.
Triaged for 3.0. Please review if this can be fixed in 2.0.1

Created an attachment (id=78091)
Use as the test JSP

Forgot to post this before.

I believe we can fix this safely for 2.0.1.

DTTagConverter's are responsible for loading their own images (via MD services) and so are also responsible for disposing them.

There is an attempt made to draw the image between the time it is disposed (caused by disposal of the DTTagConverter) and the time that a new image is loaded (caused by re-instantiation and subsequent calls for a new image on the new DTTagConverter). By guarding against the attempt to draw when the image has been disposed, the exceptions related to images are prevented, but no functionality is lost.

Requesting approval to apply attached patch to 2.0.1 stream.
Save fix and is definitely required.
